intro: Randia lundelliana, commonly known as the Lundell's randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It produces small, round fruits that are typically yellow or orange when mature. Randia lundelliana is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and flowering habit.
